text: Robert "Bob" Boucher (March 23, 1938 – December 16, 2004) was a Canadian ice hockey player and coach. He is best known for coaching the Saint Mary's Huskies for 13 years, leading the Huskies to four straight national championship games. He served for two seasons as an assistant coach for the Philadelphia Flyers under head coach Pat Quinn. He died at age 66 after a short battle with lung cancer. ==References== ==External links== * *The Bob Boucher Hockey Assistance Fund Category:1938 births Category:2004 deaths Category:Canadian ice hockey coaches Category:Canadian ice hockey right wingers Category:Chicoutimi Saguenéens (QMJHL) players Category:Sportspeople from Ottawa Category:Memorial Cup winners Category:Philadelphia Flyers coaches Category:Ice hockey people from Ontario
title: Bob Boucher (ice hockey)
